title: Microscopy Study and Mechanical Behavior on PETG with 40% and 100% Infill
content: Glycol Modified Polyethylene Terephthalate Filament (PETG) has made great advances in recent years, using the technology known as fused deposition modeling (FDM), which continues to evolve and adapt to different needs, highlighting the search for more accessible materials for applications in current medicine and biomedical areas [1]. Likewise, the characterization of the different structures obtained by additive manufacturing by microscopy allows observing different types of defects, such as micropores, voids and micro-delamination, which influence on the mechanical properties [2, 3], this being essential to investigate printed structures and their mechanical properties with the purpose of contributing information for possible automotive, electronics and aerospace applications [4, 5].
